Setting up business process flowcharts
Business process is a flowchart of interaction, an algorithm that users apply to achieve a result (including the execution of system automatic actions).
Switching to configuring the business process flowchart is possible from the
business process profile
after selecting the
process version
by clicking the
button.
Debugging of the business process flowchart is performed on the workspace of the business process profile by dragging and dropping the necessary elements from the panel.
To
create a new element
in the business process flowchart, drag it from the panel on the left.
To
connect elements in the flowchart
, select the starting element and drag an arrow to the target element.
The names of elements are set on the business process flowchart itself after double-clicking on it.
The following features are provided in the control panel:
– the button for saving the BPMN flow chart;
– the button for saving the flow chart created in the workspace on the user’s device in .svg format;
– the button that will open
business process settings
in the modal window;
"Make version up to date" – the button to assign the "Up to date" status to the current version (more information about
versioning of business processes
);
The button is available  the business process object when it’s opened with the "Draft" or "Archive" status.
With permissions to "Edit" the business process object, the name of the business process can be changed in the "Name" field.
"Process version status" displays the status of the current version;
"Process version" is an element for changing/creating a version of a business process.
Switching between existing versions of the process is done via a drop-down list, creating a new version of the process is available via the actions menu.
The business process profile is opened from the current window.
To avoid data loss, if changes have been made to the business process flowchart, they should be saved before opening the business process profile.
Each element of a business process has a set of parameters.
To view the parameters
of a business process element, click on the corresponding flowchart element and select the
button in the displayed action icons.
Viewing element properties is only available after saving the business process for the first time.
If the list of icons for an element is not displayed, then:
the scale is too small, in this case it is necessary to increase the scale of the chart (by scrolling the mouse wheel);
pop-up windows are blocked in the browser.
After clicking on the settings
button, the system will display the profile of the selected element of the business process flowchart. The settings depend on the element group.
The business process flowchart is implemented in BPMN 2.0 and consists of the following groups of elements:
elements of the "Event" flow (StartEvent)
;
start
;
intermediate
;
end
;
gateways (ExclusiveGateway)
;
actions (Task)
;
areas of responsibility (pools and lanes)
;
artifacts (annotations)
.
The DataObjectReference element (DataObjectReference)
is
not used
in the System.
The "Lasso" tool
is  used to simultaneously select several objects on the chart.
The configured stages of the business process are defined in the System as the "
WorkFlow. Business process stage
"
object type
(or its child type).
The running business process will be defined as the "
WorkFlow. Instance of the running process
"
object type
(or its child type). These types of objects contain both system and user attributes.
